bibl.title: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, December 31, 1900

div1.p: Lawrence Reed gives his thoughts regarding his father's success in the yellow fever experiments. He makes plans for a visit to a Cuban sugar plantation.

div1.head: Letter from Lawrence Reed to Emilie Lawrence Reed, December 31, 1900
div1.p:
Your letter written
the 23rd reached me on Sunday
as usual & I am so glad
to hear that you are so
bright & happy- Indeed Father
has been wonderfully successful
with his experiments & I
trust the reward will be
bountiful for he has worked
hard for so many years
My only regret is I fear
that I will never be worthy
to be called his child-

Well we have had
a mighty nice Xmas and
tonight we are all going
out to a beautiful plantation
to a dance it is one of
the richest & prettiest in
Cuba, is about 25 miles
from Cienfuegos- Expect
to get home about 4 A.M.

I do hope Bessie will
call on you often for she
certainly has proven to be
the truest girl friend I have
ever had -- and I only wish
she would permit me to
take my old place-

Well I must cut this
letter short- But will write
you soon again, with
dearest love for Blossom
& yourself
div1.closer: I am Your devoted Son Lawrence.
